Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, my sons, now that I have completed this book, which is the last of the sciences of medicine, by completing its purpose at the end and through its explanations and clarifications, it seems to me that I have made clear to you the treatise which concerns what I do myself, namely surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For surgery is completely neglected in our region and in our time, to the point that the practice of it has almost disappeared and its knowledge remains scarce; we only find small descriptions of it in the books of the Ancients, which have altered much of it, leading people into error and hesitation because they do not understand its principles and thus weaken its power and art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I should revive this treatise according to the order of exposition and clarification and abbreviation; and so that it comes with the forms of cautery tools and other instruments for the work as mentioned by adding explanations and preparation, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the reason why a good practitioner is not readily found in our profession at this time is that the art of medicine is extensive, and one must be well exercised in the science of anatomy, which involves knowing the functions of the members and their forms, as well as their connections and separations; understanding the bones, nerves, and muscles, their numbers and distributions; and the pulsating and non-pulsating veins, along with their origins.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this reason Hippocrates said that in name there may be many, but few in actual practice, especially in the art of hands.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	This may we have said about that at the introduction of this book; for who is not learned in what we have said about anatomy, is not exempt from falling into error through which men are made to die, as I have seen too many of those, for some are formed in this science and throw themselves from that lack of science and lack of experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish doctor who had incised an abscess in the neck of a woman and cut some arteries of the neck, so much blood flowed that the woman died shortly thereafter.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who attempted to remove a stone from a man who was ill, and the stone was large, and he came to him and pulled out that stone along with a piece of the bladder, whereupon that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I had already called out to avoid removing that stone, and I saw that because of the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, I recognized that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who was receiving payment from a duke of our land for surgery, and he attended to a black castrated man who had a fracture in his thigh; and because of the doctor's ignorance, he exposed the fracture over the wound with splints and sticks in a strong structure, but did not leave the wound breathing.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And he loosened it according to his desires, and then bandaged it, and after a few days commanded us to loosen the bandage. And thus between the time of loosening and rebandaging, the thigh and leg became abscessed, and he came to ruin.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And he calls out to him, and he prepares to untie the ligature, and when calm is achieved he begins to alleviate his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But when corruption was confirmed in the limb, so that it could not be restrained, and the corruption did not cease to spread throughout the limb until the patient was in danger.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another surgeon who incised a cancerous abscess, and it became ulcerated within a few days, to the extent that it greatly revealed the skill of his lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The reason the malignant cancer is clear of melancholic humor is that it does not need to reach the heart entirely, but rather remains in the member which can tolerate being completely affected by it.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, children, it is necessary for you that the operation be devised in two aspects: one is an operation associated with health, and the other is a work involving great risks.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already stated this in every part of this book where there is an operation involving error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to guard against that and leave aside this, so that the pages do not find a way to speak falsely and dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And so take up your weapons with diligence and the protection of God, and may your patients be with you in fortune and steadfastness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best path by the grace of God to lead to health and praiseworthy success, and avoid terrible diseases that are difficult to heal, and remain armed against what causes you fear, so that hesitation in your faith and reputation does not evade you: for it remains more for your glory, and less in this world and later in regard to your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Wound treatment in some monastic surgeries:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat illness badly, for thus bad doctors are not named.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have dedicated this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter is ordered about the head and neck, in the forms of the instruments and in the tools of the cautery, and of what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, about lancing and puncturing, and about cupping, and plasters, and the extraction of arrows and similar items, all chaptered and ordered regarding the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, about restoration and dislocation, and the treatment of twists and similar conditions; a chapter ordered concerning the head and neck, and the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	About cautery with fire and with sharp medicine and recall of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	There begins the treatise of the whole book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I shall speak of the quality of the movements of that cautery and of its ingredients, and in what condition cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	I say that the discourse on the quality of the movement of cautery and its ingredients is long and extensive, subtle by science, and hidden as a secret; and many wise people have spoken about it, and they disagree among themselves. It suffices for me to mention a little of their discourses, fearing lengthiness.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	Therefore, I say that cauteries conform to all complete configurations universally, whether they are made of matter or without matter, except for two configurations, which are tail-like configurations without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the tail-like and dry configuration made of matter, one should become cautious; for some say that cautery is helpful in such cases, while others argue the opposite, stating that cautery is not appropriate for diseases caused by heat and dryness, since the nature of fire is hot and dry, and it would be inappropriate to treat a tail-like and dry disease with something hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And let us say that those who argue the opposite are mistaken, because cautery is beneficial in all tail-like and dry diseases that occur in human bodies. For when you compare the body of a person and its humidity to the nature of fire, you find that the human body tends to be more fragile.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say according to the words of that person, that experience has already shown this to me on several occasions.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But it does not befit one who has already been trained and exercised in the chapter of cauteries through previous practice, and who knows the diversity of human configuration and the disposition of diseases in their contexts, as well as their causes and accidents, and the time span of these matters.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other configurations, there is no need for fear on your part, especially in fragile and humid diseases, since all physicians are already in agreement about those, and they do not disagree regarding the use of cautery in such cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And you know, my students, that the secret of healing with fire and its effectiveness lies in the fact that fire is simple, and its action affects only the part being cauterized without harming other parts of the body nearby, causing only minor discomfort.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	Here is the translation:
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Take the fire, by its sublimity and by the goodness of its substance, it does nothing but superfluify [evaporate]. And it is known to us through experiment and through length of service in studying the art about the truth of the causes; and thereby I excuse myself from the length of speech. And if not that it were not read in my book in this pausero [pause] to you secrets hidden with the fire, and the quality of the operation of it on the bodies and of its expulsion by which you expel diseases, with philosophical demonstrative speech, which would be sharp in your possessions.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they err who do cauteries at times which are not appropriate, and they miss the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauteries are appropriate at all times, because the harm caused by accidental time is submerged in the benefit drawn from what the cauterization attracts, and even more so if the cauterization is for pains or necessary pain, strength and boils, which do not tolerate delay due to the fear of malice coming from those that enter through improper timing.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this does not concern your possessions, or, children, what is valued only by the common people and foolish doctors is that for the disease which is healed by cauteries, it is not always timely, and they miss that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not as they think, for cauteries are nothing but a substitute for medicine that alters the complexion and dries up the humidity which is the cause of pains.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But still, cauteries are superior in medicine due to the speed of their effectiveness and the virtue of their operation and the greatness of their power.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that his illness may return at some time according to the condition of the patient and the location of his illness, and its nature, and what is prepared in him from the accumulation of superfluities within him, and what has reached him through his acquisition in food and similar causes; but if the illness for which cautery was administered is a subtle one involving few superfluities and humidities, such as the cautery of a tooth for pain and the like, it may not return that pain, but this happens rarely.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And the common saying is that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is the saying of craftsmen, not because those who understand it think there is no cure in medicine or any other cause before cautery, but because they believe that once cautery is necessary, it is the most effective treatment.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and the understanding that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is only when we administer methods of treatment for certain illnesses, and those medicines do not suffice, and then at the end of the process, cautery is administered, and it proves effective.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And here at this point it is said that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the understanding which I grasp of the common and excessive practices of foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and its superior quality in substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place for cautery does not matter, which is absolutely not true, because I have seen it proven and corrected that this works only on certain bodies and not others. Cautery with gold can be better than with iron, as they say; however, when you use fire with gold, it is not clearly defined, since the hardness of the gold affects how much heat it can withstand, and it prepares to receive friction. If you adjust the heat, the gold will melt due to the fire, and if you place some sheets in the fire, the craftsman can work on them during this process.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And thus it is done with cautery made of iron, you should remove the pus gently and gradually according to the correctness of the procedure.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already arranged this chapter on cautery according to the chapters, and I have arranged those of the head among the priorities, so that I may relieve the seeker of what they ask for.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cautery for headache due to cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery is applied to the humidity and coldness of an accidental ailment caused by these two causes, which are the cause of rheumatism and various types of flu, called corissa, affecting the head and parts of the ears with fluid discharge, excessive sleep, toothache, and throat pain, and generally all diseases that come from coldness, such as paralysis, stroke, and similar conditions in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is as follows: First, command the patient to evacuate with laxative medicine for the head purification, for three or four nights, depending on the strength of the patient and their age and habits.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and then place him seated on a padded bench and have him rest his head on his hands.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the palm of your hand near the nose on the shaved area between his eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But when the temperature of your hand has reached it, mark that spot with a needle, and then ignite the olive wood cautery, which is made as follows:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And after that pause, place it on the marked spot, in such a way that it descends, with which the skin may be gradually stretched, and you rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand gently and look at the spot, and if you see any quantity of bone already exposed, like the amount of wheat grains, then raise your hand, and if not return your hand to that tool or another of those, if it is chilled, until you can see the bone as I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it on the spot and let it be for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place it on the wound enclosed in leather and let it be inside until the burn scar is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the spot with a quadruple ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they say that when the plague has opened up, the arm recovers better and more quickly.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the wound should be cauterized down to the bone, and the cautery should be kept until it adheres to some part of the bone.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove what is adhered to the bone, and then it should be treated.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that with the cautery reach to the deepest part, until it presses strongly on the bone until the bone melts, and this is the method of treating small wounds.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they consider that vapors from the head expire from that place.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And let the wound be treated for a long time until it is healed and has consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two species of cautery in all cases, but only on some people out of fear; and leave that one, if you please, for it is better to preserve health when possible; for the head becomes inflamed by the solution of continuity as we have testified in other members, and especially when the constitution of the patient is cold.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first species of cautery is safer and better in my opinion; and with that one you can preserve health and well-being.
Capitol segon.	Chapter Second.
Del cauteri del cap.	On Cautery of the Head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and long-lasting pain occurs throughout the head and this is prolonged in the patient, even after using herbs, cloths, compresses, plasters, poultices, cats, hens, and similar treatments, especially if it has already been cauterized with a cautery which we have described but without any benefit from those causes, then consider whether the constitution of the patient’s head is strong in nature; and if it is not cold and shows no great sensitivity, then proceed to cauterize with another type of cautery below that one slightly.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that area on the crown of their head with a cautery until the pain is alleviated.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut open the affected area and expose the bone in the quantity that we have described, and cauterize it with a cautery at the back of the head in the place called "vas," — which is the location where the windpipe is situated.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And be careful here and do not expose the bone, for the patient will suffer great pain different from the pain of all other cauteries of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And here I will describe this cautery in its place, for it is appropriate that the cautery with which you cauterize the horns of the head and the occiput is a finer cautery than that with which the middle part of the head is cauterized; and this is the form of it.
Capitol ters.	Chapter Three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On Cauterization of Non-Ancient Hemorrhoids.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When severe pain occurs in the head region or persistent pain inside the skull, it should be evacuated with medicines that purify the head, and other treatment should be administered as I have described for various diseases; and if this does not improve the condition, cauterization is then performed in two ways: either cauterization with an acute combustible medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But if you perform cauterization with a combustible medicine, then take a piece of cotton wool, soak it in the medication, and tie off both ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then incise the area of the pain on the temple with a lancet, cutting just deep enough to reach beneath the skin, so that it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then apply pressure to it with a bandage in a moderate compression, and leave it like that for three hours; then loosen it and remove the cotton wool, and let the wound be treated for two or three days, after which press upon it with a piece of cloth soaked in butter until the area becomes warm.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, take care of that wound with dressing so that it may heal.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, apply some medicines that burn, of which I have written in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But when you use cauterization with this method, here is the fire for cauterizing, of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a nail clamp, because its head is in the shape of a nail, which has some curvature, and at the middle part of it there is a small prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then press on the location of the pain, and hold your hand—so that the artery below is not adhered—and move the tool gently little by little with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of it that adheres due to the specificity of the condition is such that half of it is adhered, raise your hand so that the artery below is not adhered, so that there is no bleeding.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then soak cotton in salt water and place it on the location, and leave it for three days; and then apply dry cotton with borders, and afterward take care of the wound with dressing so that it may heal.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize at the end of the radial bone according to the cautery method, and guard against cutting the artery in this proper but non-traditional procedure.
Capitol quart.	Chapter four.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cauterization of an ancient ulcer.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat an ulcer as we have described in the previous treatment and in the divisions of diseases, and if it does not improve, and sometimes due to the disease, what we have mentioned about the first cautery with medicine or the cautery with fire is insufficient, then it is necessary for you to ignite the radial cautery until it becomes white-hot. Place it on the location of the pain along a line as long as half your finger or slightly more; and then move your hand once and press firmly so that it does not adhere to the artery but penetrates into the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, you must be careful about the continuity of the mandible, which is necessary for chewing, and ensure that the muscle is not adhered to and the nerves which move it are not affected, and that a spasm does not occur.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the care and caution regarding the flow of blood from the artery that is being tied off, because there is fear in doing so, especially for one who does not know what they are doing and is not diligent and experienced; and leave the operation to someone else at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And here I will come to the recall of the regimen for controlling blood flow in cases involving arteries according to the usual method, in its proper place in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this disease does not respond to these cauteries and the patient's condition is tolerable, cauterize in the appropriate place of the head as we have recounted, and treat the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you perform the cauteries that we have mentioned in the chapter on the rupture of arteries with a cautery having two edges, this is a better and more effective cautery.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cautery for ear pains.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When pain in the ear occurs due to inflammation and is treated with laxative causes and other treatments that I have mentioned in the division, and if the pain does not improve, now use cautery. This is one called puncta, which has the following form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And apply the puncta near the fire, and move it around the entire ear as a wheel revolves, or around each part where the pain is located.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Take the cautery of the hair removal from the ear little by little until you have marked the place with it.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery of these points throughout the ear, and which ones accordingly, and promptly treat the areas until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cautery of torticollis.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torticollis, which is cured by cautery, is not caused by any specific type of phlegm, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Cautery is avoided for the type that arises from dryness or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that type of torticollis with jars and capipurgi and guargarisms, and if your treatment does not confere (succeed), then it is necessary for you to cauterize the disease with three cauteries: the first should be at the root of the ear, and the second a little away from the temple, and the third should be at the junction of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery on the opposite side of the affected part, because softening occurs only in the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cautery is that you cauterize it with the cautery at the side of the uppermost part of the ear, a little above the horn of the head, and on the temple another, whose length should be according to the length of the middle finger, and then place your hand with the cautery until half the quantity of the root is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the form of cautery, and it is specific to the scissor-like instrument, the form of which is laid out above.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is even more subtle that there is a small amount as you see; and it is necessary to use a knife instead of excessive coarseness in this small amount.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And properly care for the area with water that has been previously processed until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On the cautery treatment for chronic apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is chronic and you treat it with water as we have said and do not induce fever through your medication, then cauterize the area using four cauteries: on top of all parts of the head; and at the point where we have mentioned, in the middle of the head; and one cautery on the nape of the neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method of the cautery is done as mentioned above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized over the mouth of the stomach; and this is better; and now it should be treated with water that you have prepared.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On the cautery treatment for forgetfulness performed with flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	It is necessary to give the patient large doses and pills at the beginning to purify and cleanse them.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then shave the patient's head completely and apply a plaster to the back of the neck, as described in the chapter on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	In some cases, cautery should be used, for that is the method of treatment.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	Do this according to the order which I have already mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if this heals the wound well, it is good; but if not, then apply three cauterizations to the rear part of his head, which should descend from the most superior part of the head down to the part nearest the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And after each cauterization, wait until the swelling of the finger subsides, and then proceed with the next cauterization.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you prefer and the condition allows it, then apply the cautery in a moderate manner; and if you wish for a stronger effect, then apply it over both sides.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then proceed with the care to ensure it heals; and let the cautery be olive-shaped as described above.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the cautery of parasites and the softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Proceed with the purification of the head using shears and as we have discussed; then shave the patient's head, and afterward apply cautery in a moderate location on the head, over all parts of the head, over the rear part of it, and with three cauterizations over the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary for the illness of softening the body to do so and the patient can tolerate it and the illness is severe, then apply four cauterizations over the vertebrae of the back, and finally apply one cautery deep into the area below the armpit, and raise the skin slightly.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	For the treatment of that which should be healed, use this; and for that which should be cauterized, use olive.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the cautery for epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	An epileptic is not cauterized unless the epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And so it is necessary to modify the brain of the patient at the beginning of the year and follow the other treatment that we have described in the division when the patient is strong and can tolerate the exception of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who cannot tolerate medicines, then administer gentle treatments and food that purifies the brain, for several days before this, along with the improvement of diet.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then shave the patient's head, and afterwards cauterize one area in the middle of the head according to the previous method, and with another cauterization at the occiput, and on each side of the head as well.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and can tolerate it, then cauterize as I have described, with paralysis and relaxation of the body over the cervical vertebrae and the thoracic vertebrae.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And use olive cauterization as was previously mentioned.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then use gentle cauterization according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the cautery for melancholia.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholia are corrupted humidity and thick phlegm, then cauterize that part with the cauteries which we have mentioned in the case of paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholia is excess leaning towards melancholy, and the body of the patient is humid, then give him to drink what purifies his brain as was mentioned earlier according to the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then shave the head of the patient, and then make a poultice properly prepared over the circle, and then place it in the middle part of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient should be seated, and held from all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply a liniment; it is more suitable to use before sheep's wool.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And warm that on the fire with moderate heating as needed, which the patient can tolerate when it is applied.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then place that in the middle part of the head in the circle, and let it be rubbed there.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this for the patient once a week, following another regimen until he is healed; or if you prefer, cauterize that in small points as needed, but have your hand guided by a properly ordered cautery: this is a special type of cautery which moistens the brain with equilibrium.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that paste in cloth or in linens of chicken feathers.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On the cauterization of water descending in the belly.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have identified the beginning of water in the urine by the signs that I mentioned in the division, then start giving the sick person to drink water that cleanses the head, and guard him from all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make him sweat in baths for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then command him to shave his head, and cauterize that area with one cautery in the middle of the head; and then cauterize that area with two cauteries on both temples if it is the beginning of water appearing in two urines, or on one side if it is the beginning of water appearing in one urine.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Inciase with one cautery all the veins and arteries that you see near the temples; and place the cauteries at a distance in the latitude of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And guard against bleeding when he is cauterized; and if you see him bleeding, stop the bleeding with some medicine that is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will come to the knowledge that is in the extraction of arteries and the ligation of them and the caution against bleeding.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized on the neck near two bones with two cauteries placed backward, producing a result.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On the cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears from the eyes are old and constant, passing through veins and arteries that are visible on the surface of the head, and it is verified that this is cold phlegmatic excess, then cauterize in one place as we have recounted in the chapter on the beginning of water accumulating in the urine, and with one cautery in the middle of the head, and with two cauteries in the neck near two temples, and with two cauteries in the neck near two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you need an addition, then cauterize that at the full length of the nail of the finger on the extremity of the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter xiiii.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On Cauterization for Nasal Discharge.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat him with what we have mentioned in the division and it does not benefit from your treatment, then prepare and give the sick person cochineal to drink for three nights; afterwards, shave his head and cauterize the affected area with a medium-sized olive cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize that with a carnation-sized cautery, using two cauteries above the two eyebrows, just over the hair, a little bit.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful with the cauterization so that you do not burn it excessively.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the carnation-sized cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter .xv.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On Cauterization for Softening the Eyelids.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid is softened due to illness or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with this lunar-shaped cautery; and this is the form of it:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you do so, cauterize that above the two eyebrows a little with two cauteries in total, and let them be longer toward the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the quantity of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	Do not press too hard with your instrument when using cautery, but rather to the extent that one third of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On using cautery on the eyelid when the hairs have turned inward and are piercing the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eyelid turn inward and pierce the eye, cautery is applied in two ways: either by using an instrument or by applying a combustible medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If cautery is done with fire, instruct the patient beforehand to trim their eyelashes as those of people in general, making them longer and even; and if they are piercing due to their growth from the root, then bandage the eyes so that nothing enters until the new lashes grow.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	When they have grown and become even, then instruct the patient to place their head in your lap, and gently apply a bandage over the eyelids, shaped like a maple leaf, with the beginning of the bandage near the lashes.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And gently place a piece of boiled hen's feather or mucilage of silk over the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then perform the cautery according to this method.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize over the shape you have marked, little by little, in small strokes, until the surface of the area shaped like a myrtle leaf is burned thoroughly and clearly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	A sign of health in this work is that you see the eyelid already contracted and the hairs raised around the piercing of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And thus raise your hand and wash it for three days, and then place it on the wound edge until the scar is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then take care of that until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if the hair returns due to some cause and the eyelid is relaxed, now perform the cautery on that again just as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hair remains on the eyelid below, then cauterize that until it is raised to its natural place and healed so that the hair does not touch the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery and medicinal burning are such that you command the patient to pluck the hair until it is lengthened and healed, and then make from paper or cloth the shape of a myrtle leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take known soap and one ounce of live caus (likely a typo or archaic term), and mix these causes well, and apply it quickly so that it is not rubbed; then spread this over the paper made in the shape of a myrtle leaf, and place it on both eyes; and place a cloth-covered bandage under the eye, and the patient's head should be in your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place your finger on the medicine and press it slightly so that the patient feels the sensation of the medicine, for this sensation is like being burned by fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And thus, when the swelling and biting ceases, leave off the medicine and wash with the water you mentioned; then once the biting stops, resume washing the wound with water. Then consider whether the eyelid has already risen as it was washed; if so, bind it with heat or incision because that is better. And if not, go back to applying the medicine in the place where no medicine has been applied and do not let it darken until your operation is well done and the wound contracted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then pause on the wound at the edge until the trace of the adjustment is eradicated, and then treat that with definite definition or another method until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you to guard with diligent vigilance that no part of the medicine falls into the wound. And if after some days the eyelid becomes softened and any cause for hair grows in the wound, then reapply your medicine to the place where the eyelid has become softened, and properly as you did at the beginning, and then wait until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the form of the leaf of myrtle.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the wounds of people vary in size and magnitude, and therefore according to this, you adjust your treatment.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the way of rectitude will not be hidden from one who studies in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cautery treatment of a fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat fistula with the water that we have mentioned in the sections on diseases and do not confer your treatment, then it is necessary that you cauterize it according to this method: command the patient to place his head or thigh in your hand, and hold the head of a cautery between your hands but in such a way that it is neither too much nor agitated near the head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And place some cotton in an eggshell or in a powder of petals on the wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then heat the cautery which has this form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is hollow, as it has the shape of a reed or eagle's feather, with one end through which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, it can penetrate into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to be as thin as a thread.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But the one that is hollow is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open, and let some of the pus come out and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place the cautery, which should be well heated, on it, and hold it there for a moment but not too long, so that you do not burn the wound or disturb the patient, and then place the cautery on the edges of the wound and cauterize it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And if at the beginning of your cauterization it penetrates to the bone, that is good; but if not, then repeat the cauterization once or twice if necessary; and leave it like that for three days, and then place some cotton on it and around it with a drying ointment until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If after ten days it has not healed, then at that time apply acute corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed, according to what is convenient in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another method of cauterizing a fistula, which the ancients first described: enter into the location of the fistula and make an incision in it; then apply to that fissure finely powdered material made from its form. And pour into it one ounce of molten lead; hold your hand gently but firmly so that the pus does not come out where the molten lead reaches; and you must place over the wound cotton soaked in egg white or water, because lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it miraculously.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cauterization and treatment, it is good; but if not, then it is necessary to administer traction through the nose and reduce the fistula to the body of the nose as it will come into its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cauterization of the cleft of the buttocks.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Fissures often occur in the lips, and more commonly in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those fissures with what we have mentioned in the divisions and your treatment is not effective, then use small knife cauterization according to this form that will be described:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let the sharpness of it be according to the fineness of the blade.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then apply that hot instrument carefully to those fissures until the cauterization reaches the base of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	Let the treatment of that which is inside with wax be carried out so that it may be healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cautery treatment for a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When there is an abscess in the uvula or on the palate or at the roots of the teeth below, and it causes pain, and then it breaks, and becomes old, and pus flows and a fistula is formed, and when you treat that one and it does not improve with treatment, now you must ignite a cautery according to the amount received in the fistula, and then place that heated part into the track of the fistula, and do this so that the fire reaches the beginning of it; and at last do this once or twice. And afterwards treat it as we have said for internal treatment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And if the fistula is severed and heals, that is good; but if not, then it is necessary to expose the location and remove the corrupted bone as will be described in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cautery treatment of teeth and on softening the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are unhealthy, and you treat them with medicines but without success, now place the tip of the malatue (a tool) in your mouth, and then ignite the cautery whose form will be described shortly. Place the quill (a thin rod or tube) over the tooth and insert the ignited cautery into it quickly, and hold it with your hand for a short time until the heat from the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then take your hand away, and then repeat the cauteries as often as you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then the patient should rinse his mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out, for the bad tooth is hardened and the softened gum is strengthened and the corrupted moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the cautery for toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is due to coldness, or there is decay or worm damage, and if you do not wish to treat it with medicine, then the cautery should be applied in two ways: either with a cow's horn or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with a horn is when you take a cow's horn and heat it over charcoal, then take cotton and wrap it around the tip of the horn, and then immerse that heated horn in the hot horn until it is warm, and place it quickly on the painful tooth before it cools.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	Then repeat that several times until the effect of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, soak wool or cotton in the aforementioned horn and place it on the painful tooth, and then apply heated iron to it until the heat reaches the source of the pain in the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, when using cautery with fire, you should attend to the length of the tube made of lead or iron, and it should be of such a size that the intensity of the heat does not reach the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	From the heating of the cautery, the form of which will be described, and place it on the tooth until the cautery is rubbed enough; and do this several times so that the pain subsides either on that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it happens that by pressing that cautery, the patient fills their mouth with good saliva and holds this for an hour, then spits it out; and this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize as much as you wish according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On Cauterization of Hemorrhoids.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hemorrhoids are full of phlegm and humors that resist digestion despite medication and you wish to aid their digestion gently, then you heat the cautery according to the form of which is described below. It has two open ends so that the smoke can escape; hold the cautery by one end, and place the heated part on the hemorrhoid once, or another time if needed, until it reaches the root of the hemorrhoid.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the hemorrhoid is small, then place the cautery according to the size of the hemorrhoid, and after that leave it for three days, then place it on the wound in saliva until what the fire has burned is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then take care of it with applications, bandages, and dressings until it is healed.
