E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take some cotton and wrap it around the extremity of the wound, then dip the cotton in the medicine, and insert both the wound and the cotton into a tube so that the cotton adheres to that tube. Do this as many times as necessary until you achieve what you want from cauterizing the grape, and afterwards let it be so that it dries up and falls off after three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you need to repeat the medicine, do so. Then after cauterization, clean around the wound with cotton soaked in it, and modify what is around that with the substance from the medicine, let it be washed with wet water, and treated externally with an embrocation, and proceed with cautery inside until it heals.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this kind of treatment is safer than incision and longer in duration out of fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	In some cases, the wound is treated with something that is gentler than cauterization and incision. It is healed through sublimation in this manner: take salve, hyssop, thyme, rue, Arabian cardamom, chamomile, and similar herbs; mix all these ingredients or some of them in a pot, and immerse them in sour wine, then boil it. The pot should be moderately heated, and at the bottom of the pot place a tray made of reeds in this way; it can be made of silver or reed.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And insert the extremity into the mouth of the pot so that the vapor reaches the wound above the tube until the wound is sufficiently covered by the steam.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And afterwards repeat this several times until it dries up, and be careful not to perform this treatment at the beginning of the onset of abscesses, as it would be too harsh on the abscess. You should not do this; instead, you should allow the abscess to come to a head before cauterizing.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	If this instrument is not at hand, take a reed and attach to it a piece of cloth at the end, so that the mouth of the patient may be protected, for the cloth of the cloth prevents the vapor from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter XXXVIII.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the extraction of spines and of what adheres in the gums and of other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Certain objects may adhere to the gums or be caused by a fish bone or some other reason.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then you should remove what is obvious from those objects, upon which your sight falls, and press the tongue with an instrument in front of it, so that it may be revealed to you what is in the gum.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And what does not appear and is hidden in the gum, you should make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, for the cause attached to the gum will be easily expelled by vomiting; or have the patient swallow a piece of bread or lettuce leaves or a dry biscuit; or take a piece of dried sea sponge, tie it firmly with thread, and have the patient swallow that, as it passes to the place where the spine is, then it will expel it.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And if you take an eel and bind it with thread soaked in honey, place it gently and remove it carefully; or take a probe and gently insert it and then carefully extract it.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	And if it does not expel with the causes we have mentioned, then use an instrument made of lead in this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And let the pus be thick and run a small needle into it, and at its extremity make an incision which you shall insert into its mouth with facility.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And when you place the sick person upright, and be careful not to touch his bone of the throat, for so it would hurt him and those who hold him, or that the physician with his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But let the patient himself insert it if he can do so skillfully, knowing the place of the cause and holding on to it, and pulling his hand with the instrument up, all this according to the quantity which is prepared within until it is properly done.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter XXXIX.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the Removal of a Bloodsucker Attached to the Throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When a bloodsucker is treated with what we have said in the division of treatment with medicines and not compresses, consider the hours of the day when the patient is exposed to the sun, since you have already prepared his tongue with the instrument that we have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Then if you see the bloodsucker, remove it gently with a small incision or with subtle gestures carefully.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible for you to remove it then, take a concave tube and insert it into the patient's throat, and subsequently place a heated iron in the concavity of the tube, and do this as many times (until the bloodsucker is dead and falls from the throat) and let the patient abstain from water for the entire day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a vessel full of fresh water and pour it into his mouth, and wash the mouth with it; and do not let any cause prevent you from doing this, and pour the water out gradually with his hand, for as soon as the bloodsucker feels the water, it will try to escape.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	If it is not too much trouble with what we have recommended, then fumigate the wound with camphor or with asafetida with the instrument which we have recommended for the fumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, so that it may fall out.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And this is another method of operation in fumigation of that area: take an urn in which there are burning coals and the urn is covered with a cover in the middle of which is a hole; attach the end of the instrument to that hole, and proceed with the fumigation from above. Have the patient place their mouth on the end of the tube, and close their mouth so that the fumigation does not escape until you know that the fumigation has reached the bloodletting point, for the blood will immediately come out.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not come out, then proceed with the fumigation multiple times, and prevent the patient from drinking, and give salty foods and herbs, and do not let them drink water. It is also necessary that they follow this regimen strictly.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which bloodletting from the groin is performed when it is visible; and it resembles forceps as you may have seen, but it has some curvature.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed in the groin, and the end of it resembles the beak of a heron, which is sharpened with a file, so that when it compresses any area, it does not slip.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which the essence of the discourse on the preparation for treating abscesses and their incision is summarized.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are various types of swellings, of many kinds, as I recall them, each in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	They are diverse in their puncture and incision by two methods, of which one is according to the type of abscess itself; and by what they contain of moisture.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second method concerns the locations where they occur in the body, for an abscess that occurs in the head is different from one occurring in the buttocks; and an abscess in a fleshy part of the body is different from one occurring at a joint; and each has its treatment by operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And there are some abscesses that should not be punctured but allowed to reach maturity of the pus within them or until they come to a head.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And there are other abscesses that should be evacuated when they are small and have not reached maturity according to their full development, such as abscesses near joints, because an abscess close to a joint can extend into the surrounding area until you puncture it, which could corrupt the ligaments or nerves of that joint, causing contraction of the limb; or if it is near a principal part of the body, and if you delay its puncturing while it matures, it may endanger the main member; or if it is close to the buttocks, then puncture it before it has matured; but do not puncture it when it is raw, due to incomplete digestion, except for one near the buttocks, so that it does not perforate deeply into the internal parts of the buttocks and cause a fistula or spread further without healing.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	But it is important that you know the right time to puncture the abscess, and this is when it has matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And know that it is matured when there is the cessation of pain and the subsidence of fever, and soon after the decrease in inflammation and pulse rate, and the sharpness at the head of the abscess, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And take care that you know the puncture should be made in the place where the pus is deepest in the abscess and from which pus comes for the healing of the elevation.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the puncture should always be made along the length of the flesh or body if the abscesses are in the parts of the arms or legs, and in places of tendons, ligaments, nerves; and finally, in all other equal places where there is no reflection; for in those that do reflect, use a puncture according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the abscess is in a fleshy place, it is best to wait until the internal puncture is confirmed after proper digestion of the second stage, as we have said; for if you puncture before that, it will prolong the illness of the patient and cause excessive harm, and make the lips of the abscess harden and deepen.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some abscesses should be punctured across the length of the flesh or body due to necessity, or according to what the member requires.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And it is necessary to administer a small puncture, and in large abscesses, a larger puncture or multiple sections according to the diversity of the size of the abscesses.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And in other abscesses where it is necessary for the incision to be hollowed out and dissected, when it is made as such, it should be done at a time when it has already become mature, just as in cases of excessive swellings and buboes.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And among those that are incised is one having three angles; and of this kind is the one which is incised as in the figure of a myrtle leaf, like the abscesses of the fingers.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And among those to which round incision and lunar incision are administered, and similar ones to these.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But in the case where none of these applies, such as with superficial lion abscesses, you should puncture it with a superficial puncture or simply make it flat.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the abscess is large and has already collected pus and sediment, you should puncture it but do not hesitate to extract all the pus at that time; having extracted one part from it, on another day incise the abscess inside, and then extract a larger portion, and continue doing this several times according to its gradation until it is fully drained.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is a young man, or pregnant woman, or small child, or elderly in debility, for in such cases the animal spirit is quickly resolved with the evacuation of the pus, and the patient easily recovers, and you should observe them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Therefore, guard this chapter with great caution, and after your puncture in which you pierce these abscesses, make sure to cleanse the plaques and then consider whether the plaque of the abscess is small or a flat incision; at that time administer some of them or of antiseptic cloth. And if the abscess is large, and the fissures of the puncture are many, then you should place wax in each tract until they heal together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the abscess you have divided a part of the cord or have concave it around the circuit, then you should fill it with old cloth or thread made from linen, as when you have treated pustules or roots, without moisture; and strengthen that on the third day; and thereafter proceed to treat it according to what is needed from the remedies until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	If blood flows during the time of your operation, then prepare water and vinegar in which to dip a cloth, and place that over the spot where the blood is flowing for several times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	If the blood continues to flow, then you should administer treatment and healing, using powders which I have recommended in various places of this our book and division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	If it is in the time of winter, and the location of the abscess is near many nerves, then you should infuse powders in vinegar and burnt oil, and place those on the affected areas.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in summer, and the areas are fleshy, then you should place powders soaked in water and oil or in vinegar and oil, and keep this moist until the third day, as we have said. Then you should open the abscess, clean it, and administer to its healing whatever is necessary until it is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary for the knowledge of the treatment of abscesses generally, but according to the method of distinction I have already said about each abscess in what manner is the way of its cure separately by chapters.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter XLIV.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	On the sectioning of abscesses that occur in the neck.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the neck of the head, small abscesses may occur, along with various types of nodes that contain membranes; and these types vary in many ways.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And they are soft, and those that contain moisture similar to jelly.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	Of those things which contain humidity similar to dust, and resembling them; and of those things which are stony, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all things, and in the extraction of those [things], there is no fear, as the extraction of those does not oppose nature.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in the section of those [things] is that you express them with an instrument whose form is appropriate for this, which is called an entromes, until you know what it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what it contains is humidity, then you should divide that with a section along its length according to a superficial section in this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begin the section from the line of .B. to the line of .G. When the humidity is evacuated, then you should excise that skin which contains the humidity, and do not leave any cause for harm, as closely observed wounds return if any cause remains.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then immerse the wound in Egyptian ointment if it is available, and if not, in water and salt; and fill the wound with this and leave it for another day, as this will dissolve all that remains of the membrane.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then repeat the treatment on that wound with Egyptian ointment a second and third time if necessary, until you are confident that there is no remaining cause of that membrane; now treat the wound with the ointment until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if the abscess contains hard lumps, then you should incise it according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	with a section having the shape of a cross, and extract once between two lips of the section and scrape it thoroughly from all sides, and exert your skill in extracting the membrane that contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	If a wound from an arrow causes trouble, then at that time do what I have recounted first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly, treat the abscess that has formed through section and treatment as we have said to you; and section on an abscess that has formed is easier, because it contains little blood and little moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes there are some of these abscesses that occur in the head in certain people who do not have much moisture throughout their body; the cause is that I once incised an abscess on the head of an old woman and found it to be like a hard, rough, white stone, which could not be broken, and if anyone were to hit it, they would hurt themselves.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	However, in other abscesses that occur in the head, this is not the case with this chapter; also, regarding abscesses that appear on children's heads and behind their ears, the section for all of these should be a superficial incision.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And pause the puncturing of those in the lower part so that the contents of the abscess can drain into the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And treat those accordingly with what is appropriate for that type of treatment.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter XLII.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the incision of scrofulas that occur in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	These abscesses often occur in the neck, armpits, and groin; and sometimes they appear in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the neck often develop between the muscles, and every scrofula among them is within its own proper layer, just as with knots and abscesses of the head, as we have recounted.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	The species of these scrofulas are spots, for only some of them are stony, and of those only the ones containing moisture, and of those only the malignant ones which do not obey cure.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Then in that one which you find to be well disposed upon examination, the color of which is clearly manifest and matches the color of the skin, and it is soft throughout, and it is not attached to the nerves of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the artery, and it is not hard; proceed to incise that at a superficial dryness above the part and below the body according to line .G. between the line .B., and peel that off entirely, and extend from the edges of the skin by one inch or two inches if you need those, as we have said concerning the abscesses of the head, and extract it little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more cautious that the vein or nerve not be incised.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And let the spatula not be sharp, so that it does not cause you to cut unnecessarily with your hand, or disturb the patient, and do not incise what is not necessary to incise; for if you were to cut a vein or artery during your operation, immediately apply a green vitriol plaster or other powders which promote blood flow, and staunch the bleeding, and leave it there until the acute stage of the abscess subsides and the inflammation becomes mollified and begins to pus.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is constricted.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation once you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And immediately inquire at the time of the operation if there is any cause for the other small scrofulas, then incise those and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is in the root of the scrofula a large vein, avoid incising that scrofula at its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	And be careful to bind that one with a firm double bandage and let it fall by itself without harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the wound with old lint which you have already soaked in Egyptian ointment, and then treat that area.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you incise that scrofula completely, then be sure to approximate the two lips of the wound and sew them together immediately so that there is no room for any superfluity.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is room for superfluous fluid due to the size of the scrofula, then be sure to incise its root and evacuate it and administer sutures as described.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for the scrofulas that contain moisture, make a superficial puncture where it appears to you the place of maturation is, and pause before making another puncture deep into the base of the mass, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer punctures, cover them with ointment and similar applications, so that it aids in the corruption of what remains to be corrupted.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And when you see the wound already cleansed, then treat it with an ointment of generative flesh so that it may be healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter XLIII.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	On the division of the pus duct of an accidental abscess in the groin.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	Thus did the ancients call this section in the epilogue, and I have not seen any man in our land who has performed that incision.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the speech of those people.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	In men who have a weak constitution, it is advisable to avoid the extraction of the epiploon, as this cannot be done safely because all the veins and the main vessels are here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	In those who have boils in the mouth or throat or behind the ears, when the illness is not in the bone, it is advisable to use the section of the epiploon to avoid the loss which is caused by perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want to do this, cut the epiploon below three circles of its own circles, or four for a smaller section along its length between two circles in quantity. The section should be made in the fat, not in the cartilage, and this location is suitable for cutting because it is devoid of flesh and the blood vessels there are few.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the physician is cautious, it is better to first extend the throat skin by one inch and then make an incision into the canal, but avoid the blood vessels if you see any reason to do so.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then cut the fat as we have recommended; and it is significant regarding the section of the canal by the phlegm which is from that secretion and by the loss of voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And let the patient rest for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore, when the hour is delayed due to fear of perforation, join two edges of the skin of the wound, but leave it slightly apart from the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	Here is the translation:
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Al-bucasis says that the main point of the speech which we have recounted is this: the exposition is nothing other than to see that some of these abscesses have already obstructed the windpipe of the patient, and the patient has come within a hair's breadth of death, and the air passage is cut off; therefore, some proceed to incise the epiglottis so that the patient may breathe over the site of the wound by some respiration, and thus be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for this reason, the command is to leave the pus inside until the maleficence of the illness is consumed; and the maleficence lasts for three days; therefore, at that time, the command is to treat the wound so that it may heal.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have seen myself is that a servant took a knife and inserted it into their windpipe and cut out a piece of the trachea, and I was called to treat them. I found the swelling as if it were that of a dying person, uncovered the wound, and saw the blood that had come from the wound in small amounts.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore, I confessed that in that case, neither a vein nor any other part had been incised, and the air was coming out of the wound, and I treated it until she healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And nothing happened to the servant except that her voice became hoarse, and after some days she returned to improvement in her condition.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that there is no fear in the section of the epiglottis.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIV.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	On the incision for an abscess that occurs in the windpipe outside, which is called a hernia of the windpipe.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This swelling, called the hernia of the groin, is a large swelling according to the colour of the body, and it occurs in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it happens in two ways, for it is either natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the natural case, there is no need for treatment.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental case happens in two ways; one of which is similar to fat nodes, and the other way is similar to a swelling caused by an artery knot, and in that case there is reason for concern.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And it is not appropriate to make an incision with a knife except in the case where it is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you should examine that and investigate it carefully with the finger, and if you find it similar to a fat node and not attached to any veins, then you incise it as you would with nodes and extract what is inside like that of hair and bursiclam; otherwise, you must thoroughly explore its nature, and subsequently treat the area with whatever is necessary for healing until it is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter XLV.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	On the Section of the Kinds of Nodes.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	There are various kinds of nodes, and I have already mentioned all their kinds in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And it is necessary for me to describe as well the difference between a node and an abscess so as to cause no doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore, I say that in an abscess there is heat and fever and severe pain until the fermentation of the excess matter subsides; and it completes putrefaction at which point the fever, pain, and heat cease.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	This may not be heat nor fever nor pain, and it continues as if there were a lion's paw in that place.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is according to the color of the body, and its beginning is like a boil and it is made thus whether larger or smaller, and they are of two kinds, either dry containing heat, or greasy and containing moisture, and the colors of the moisture are motley, as I say in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you come to the treatment of this condition, express it and inquire about its beginning at the moment which is called intromission, as its form will come in the chapter which is near this one.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And this is the method of inquiry for abscesses and all nodes, which is that you take this moment and insert it into the place most humid which you find in the abscess, and you will revolve it little by little until you know that the moment has already penetrated the tissue.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And according to the measure of the size of the abscess, you proceed accordingly, then extract the moment and observe what has come out in its wake.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the flowing moisture, of whatever color it may be, is found, then you incise it with a superficial cut as I have said regarding other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if from the wake of the moment you do not find moisture, then you know that it is greasy.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And make an incision over it in the shape of a cross according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	as I have taught you, and suspend it with threads, and scrape the tissue from all sides with ease, and preserve the skin or sac, if possible, over that area, and extract the pus from the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	If the maxilla is broken during the operation, it is not possible to extract it whole, and you must break it up into pieces so that you can remove it bit by bit until nothing remains.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	If any part of it breaks off for whatever reason, whether little or much, the remainder will return to its place according to the maxilla.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that any small part remains broken off, then apply a poultice of some corrosive powders and clean the wound, and place over it an abscess cauterizing agent, and treat it with another method until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if the remaining piece is large, then you should suture both sides of it and treat it with something that promotes healing.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	If a pulsating or non-pulsating vein is encountered, then tie it off and apply the dressing with vitriol three times so that the wound heals and the blood clot stabilizes; and afterward return to separate what is broken from the remainder.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter XLVI.
De las formas del sturmentz necessaris en seccio e perforacio.	On the forms of instruments necessary for section and perforation.
De aquels so las formas dels intromesas, e so de tres specias, que de aquels es alcu gran, e de lor es migier, e de lor es petit.	Of those, there are instruments of three types, some of which are large, some medium-sized, and some small.

La forma de intromes migier es aquesta:	The form of the medium-sized instrument is as follows:
La forma de intromes petit es aquesta:	The form of the small instrument is as follows:
Sian faytz de ferr, de alfulud, de extremitatz cayradas decentment, per so que festino le intrament en les apostemas.	Here is the English translation:
E aquestas so las formas dels experientz, e son nompnatz albered, e un de aquels es apelat berid.	These are the forms of the practitioners, and they are called albered, and one of them is called berid.
E so de tres especias, quar de lor es gran, migier e pauc.	And it consists of three types, for among them is the great one, the medium one, and the small one.
La forma de experient gran, forma de lu:	The form of the great practitioner, its form is as follows:
La forma de experient migier, forma de lu:	The form of the medium practitioner, its form is as follows:
La forma de experient pauc, forma de lu:	The form of the small practitioner, its form is as follows:
Conveneysso que sian per aquels apostemas e exituras e fistulas e bubos per so que entre aquelas so dels osses e de autras causas.	They are suitable for treating abscesses, excrescences, fistulas, and buboes, whether they affect the bones or other causes.
E so faytz redontz, grosses, leons, ayssi cum grans agulhas am las quals son cosidas las selhas, e son faytas de eram citri, o de eram o de ferr, o de argent, E las milhors so quan so faytas de eram citri.	They make rods, thick needles, and lions, just as with large needles used to sew saddles, and they are made of citron wood, or wood, or iron, or silver. And the best ones are when they are made of citron wood.
E son faytz les experient de plum negre, les quals se acordan que per aquels sian ubertas las fistulas en la conquavitat de las quals so reflexios, que sian reflectidas am la sua levitat am aquelas refleccios.	They are made by practitioners with black feathers, who agree that with these, fistulas in which there are reflections should be opened, so that the contents are reflected out due to their lightness through those reflections.
E so de tres specias, quar alcus de lor so loncs, e dels autres migiers, e dels autres breus, segon la quantitat del ample de la fistula e de la strictura de lu.	And it consists of three types, for some of them are long, and others are medium-sized, and the others are short, depending on the quantity and width of the fistula and its constriction.

Forma del experient migier de plom:	The form of the medium-sized practitioner made of lead:
Forma del experient petit de plom:	The form of the small practitioner made of lead:
Las formas dels oncis so de motas specias, quar de aquels so alcus simples, als quals es una curvitat solament, e so de tres specias: grans, paucs e migiers.	The shapes of the lancets are of various kinds, for some are simple, having only one curvature, and there are three types: large, small, and medium.
E de lor so uncis orps, e so de tres specias.	And their points are hooked, and there are three types of them.
E de aquels so uncis haventz doas curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And of those that have two curves, there are three types.
E de lor so haventz tres curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And of those that have three curves, there are three types.
E totz aquetz so necessaris en lor loc.	And all of these are necessary in their place.

And these are the forms of the knives with which nodes and abscesses are excised, and there are three kinds, for among them is a large one, a medium one, and a small one.
Forma de scapel gran:	Form of the large knife:
Forma del scapel migier:	Form of the medium knife:

Las extramitatz de aquels am les quals es fayta seccio so agudas e las autres extramitatz so no-agudas, e no so pausadas en tal manieyra, sino per que sia fayt juvament en la excorjacio dels nodes la temor de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e per aquels sia sanat le malaute e atrobe tranquilitat un petit per la adustio la qual atroba deves la excoriacio del apostema.	The sharp ends of those with which acute incisions are made are such and the other ends are not blunt in this manner, but so that during the excision of nodes there is no fear of cutting a vein or nerve, and by them the patient may be healed and peace of mind restored somewhat due to the adjustment which follows the excision of the abscess.
E aquestas son las formas de almagidas, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc, ayssi cum veyras.	And these are the forms of forceps, and there are three kinds: large, medium, and small, as you will see.
La forma de magda gran:	The form of the large forceps:
Forma de magda migier:	Form of the medium forceps:
Forma de magda pauc:	Form of the small forceps:
Sian faytas de eram e so semblantz de ray am le qual e fayt alcofol.	They are made of iron and resemble a reed from which alcohol is made.
E es en la extramitat lada punctada am spatum occultada e en aquela corr a las partidas dedintz e defora, quan tu vols, ayssi cum veses.	And it has a pointed end on the left side with a spatula hidden in it, and along that edge are parts inside and outside, as you see when you want to.
Las formas de spatimis, les quals so amaguatz entre los ditz deves la perforacio dels apostemas e no les percebo les malautes, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc.	The forms of spatulas, which are hidden between the said forceps during the puncture of abscesses so that the patient does not perceive them, and there are three kinds: large, medium, and small.
E aquestas so las formas de aquels:	And these are the forms of those:
Las formas de ventozas am las quals es abscindit le flux del sanc, e so de tres specias; gran, migiera e pauca; las formas de lu:	The forms of veins from which the blood flow is severed are of three kinds: large, medium, and small; the forms of these:
Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.	They are made of thin skin, round in some length, and they are delicate.
E cove que sian aquestas specias de ventosas deves tu grans, migieras e paucas, per so que per aquelas abscindas flux de sanc am velocitat en necessitat, e lahoras quan a tu primieyrament no es medicina.	And you should have these kinds of veins—large, medium, and small—so that with them you can sever the blood flow quickly when necessary, and at other times when primary medicine is not available.
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.	However, do not use them to sever blood in all parts of the body, and use them only in fleshy areas such as the joints of the arms and legs, and the joints of the shoulders, and the breasts and abdomen and thighs, and similarly to the fleshly joints of humans.
E alcunas veguadas son faytz de aquels strumentz autres petitz semblantz scorsas de fisacs segon aquesta forma; per les quals lo sanc es abscindit quan es fayt per fleubotomia, o deves inscizio de vena o de arceria.	And sometimes they are made of other small instruments resembling the teeth of combs according to this form; by which the blood is severed when performed for phlebotomy, or in incision of a vein or artery.
E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes they are made round according to this form:
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter XLVII.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	On the treatment of men's breasts that are similar to women's.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Sometimes the breasts of some men swell due to an excess during sleep when they begin to mature, and subsequently their breasts swell and resemble those of women, and we call them Roman apostems or abscesses.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And for that which you wish to excise, cut it in this lunar section from the line of .B. to the line of .G., then scrape away all the roughness, then fill the wound with flesh-generating medicine, then stitch together the two lips of the wound, and care for it until it is healed.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	If the mammary gland inclines towards the sides and is softened by its size just as it does in women, then cut it into two parts with its pus inside, each part in sections resembling a lunar shape, of which each should be contained within the other at their ends, such that the larger line contains the smaller one according to this form from the line of .B. and the line of .G. Then scrape away the tissue between the two lips of the wound, remove the fat, and administer what we have mentioned about suturing and powders as necessary until it is healed.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not complete the excision of what needs to be cut due to the patient's discomfort and bleeding, then fill the wound with cotton soaked in a corrosive liquid and leave it until this corrodes what remains of the fat, and then care for it until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter XLVIII.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	On the Incision of Abscesses That Occur Near the Throat.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These abscesses that occur near the throat are often of the type known as scrofula, hard and covered with a thick skin.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And of these, only some contain moisture; those that contain moisture should be cut in a lunar section according to this figure: from the line of .G. to the line of .B. And when all is evacuated from the abscess along with the pus, then fill it with dry cotton and leave it until the next day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	Let the cut be cleaned and treated with an appropriate ointment until it is healed.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the abscess is of the types of the glands or of the scrofula, then you should incise it as we have said in the section about scrofula similarly.
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	And if the plague has spread to the point of gangrene, then administer cauterization as we have previously mentioned.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter XLIX.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On the incision of abscesses that occur due to artery or vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is ruptured and the part where it was located becomes inflamed, an abscess may occur. The signs by which one can recognize whether inflammation and abscess are due to an artery or a vein: for when the abscess is due to an artery, it tends to be elongated near the front of the body; and if you press on the abscess with your fingers, you will hear a sound like a whistle.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And when it is due to a vein, it is round on the surface of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And the incision of this abscess is dangerous, especially when it occurs in the armpits, in the angles, in the neck, and in many parts of the body; it is serious, therefore care should be taken to avoid its surgical treatment, and if it is in the extremities or on the head, it should be avoided even more.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But in the case where it is due to inflammation of the artery opening, incise along the length of the part; and then carefully cut with hooks near the artery, and remove the tunics until it is exposed.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	Upon that needle I place and make it penetrate into the other side, and tie the artery with fine thread in two places, which procedure I explain in extracting two arteries, which are found in the temple.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then apply the place between two bandages with a poultice so that the blood comes out completely while it is there, and let the abscess be dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then administer treatment in which pus is generated so that the bandages can fall off; and subsequently treat it with appropriate remedies until it is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if it is an abscess due to the section of a vein, now you should have in your hand what is possible regarding the abscess and the condition, and then insert the needle below the place where you had below your hand, and make it penetrate; and tie it with double thread until you extract that from the other side, and subsequently ligature the abscess with a strong bandage as I have told you in the bandaging of vine leaves on both sides of the thread's extremities.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you fear that the thread will come out, then insert the thread with that needle below all the abscess where the first incision was made, and tie the threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	And then dry the abscess in its proper place so that when what is inside comes out, you incise the excess of the tissue, and leave what from it is adhered.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then apply powder that you have submerged in wine and oil, and subsequently administer the treatment with dressings and remedies until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter on the abscess which occurs due to nerve strain.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Just as an abscess occurs in arteries and veins, so too does an abscess occur in nerves when they are struck or due to excessive labor, and similarly.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it happens mostly in the areas of the joints or heel, or in any place where the joints are often troubled.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	It is a severe abscess and its color resembles the surrounding tissue. It is one of the worse conditions when it occurs with vehemence, and the patient appears in a state similar to stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	It is not an abscess that aggregates at the front of the body, and because of this it is less painful. It affects the entire area equally and does not concentrate in front or back.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, when it occurs in the joints, it should not be bandaged with iron, for it will likely lead to contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But when it occurs in the head or on the forehead, apply treatment with spatum (a type of poultice).
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small abscess, then treat it with forceps and incise it carefully.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if it is large, then suspend it with ligatures, and excise it properly; afterwards, close the wound with sutures, and care for it until it heals.
Capitol .li.	Chapter XI.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	On the incision of an abscess that occurs due to swelling in the abdomen.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Therefore, for some people there are growths in their bellies and in other parts of their bodies which are called mushrooms by similarity to those fungi, whose root is fine and the head of it is thick; and often the lips of these are smooth, and they are small ones, and they are of those that move magnificently.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have seen one in whom there were two parts in his belly which were larger and similar to mushrooms, and there was no difference between those white ones with fine roots.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And the lips of those were inverted and split, and moisture ran from them all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Then I incised them and found one weighing about eighteen uncias and the other about ten uncias.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation during the incision of these is that you consider if the malady is humid, and the color of the tumor is white, humid, with a fine root; then you incise it with a broad scalpel, and immediately in your presence cauterize it over fire, for the moist growths should have their section expelled by much blood; and if the blood flows, cauterize that area.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if you see the malady dry and fearful, guard against incising with iron; but now take fresh lead paste and apply it to that tumor, in the manner which we have described; and leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And immediately adjust the compression of the lead strip; therefore, do not stop applying the lead continuously until the tumor is separated and falls off by itself without effort.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	If you are dealing with a large abscess and during its incision there is reason for fear and dread, especially if it is in the abdomen.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	It is possible that you may incise most of it, and then afterward cauterize the area so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And afterwards, treat the wound until it is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And be careful not to presume to incise an abscess that is dark in color, has little sensation, and is hard upon examination, for such an abscess is likely cancerous.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And here I will recall something regarding this.

De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	On the treatment of an umbilical hernia.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	An umbilical hernia is caused by various reasons; either by fissures in the abdominal wall above the abdomen, and through these openings the membrane or bowel protrudes as in other ruptures; or by a wound from which blood flows from a vein or artery depending on its location, or by trapped air.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	If it is due to a fissure in the abdominal wall and the protrusion of the membrane, then the color of the swelling is similar to the color of the skin; it is soft without pain, and afterward appears in various situations.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is due to the protrusion of the bowel, then its appearance differs greatly from what we have described, and when you press on it with your fingers, it retreats, and afterward returns; and it is very sensitive to sound, and swells after bathing and hard work.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	May it be soft because of moisture, so that when you press upon it with your hand, it is not hidden, nor is it constricted, nor is it hardened.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is due to pus, then at this point these signs appear, the abscess turning to a declining blackness.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is due to excess flesh, then the abscess is severe, large and hard, and is seated in proportion to a quantity.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is due to airiness, then the touch of it is soft.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation in it is that you consider now whether the prominence of the navel is due to pus from an artery, or a vein, or airiness; now it behooves you to be cautious about treating it, for there is fear and dread as I have taught you in the chapter wherein I have stated the abscesses from an artery and a vein.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the prominence of the navel is due to the bowels or the membrane, then it behooves you to command the patient to lie on their back and extend themselves; then feel around the entire circumference of the navel, and then command them to stand between your hands on their back; then surround with a spatula at the edge of the navel where you have felt with your hand; then cut half of the abscess above one inch greatly; then tie around the edge with strong thread or cord in an appropriate manner.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then cut the center of the abscess extended over the ligature and insert your finger into that place to check for the bowels; and if you find them or guard them with the ligature, then you extract promptly and push the bowels to the sides within the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have found the cloth, then take one ounce of it; and incise the superfluities from it.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is contrary to your artery or vein, then encircle that spot, and return to your operation; take two needles and place them in those two strong threads and insert the two needles in the circuit which you have made around the abscess in a crisscross manner, which you should make penetrate; and then compress the abscess into four parts over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, remove the needles and let the place inside which the extended flesh may ooze and fall off by itself; or incise it when it has become softened and will ooze out, and then treat it with water from the herbs until it is healed.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the swelling of the navel is made of flesh or because of humidity, then you should conquer the abscess as we have said and extract the blood or moisture that you find there, and then treat it with what is appropriate to heal and consolidate the area.
