Method of making a plaster for the quick restoration of fractures, suitable for various conditions and especially for women and children, as it does not generate heat or irritation: take powdered flour, which is the fine residue that settles on the walls of the mill after grinding.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And confine it as it is, but sift it through white cloth, and stop the compounding of it not thin nor subtle; and then use it.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another method for plaster to restore fractures, dislocations, and twists: recipe of asafetida, of cerate, of acacia, of inula, and migraach, which is the rind of wild millet, of each one drachm; of myrrh and aloes each one half drachm; alochil two drachms; all should be thrice sifted and mixed with water or with white cloth if the composition is hot; and then use this plaster, for it is good composition and restores broken bones quickly, and confine the patient to movement.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method for a plaster to treat fractures and twists: recipe of migraach and root of white mullein one drachm; myrrh and aloes each half drachm; acacia six drachms; Armenian bole two drachms.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All should be thrice triturated in a mortar with a concave shape, and should be sifted, and should be compounded with water or white cloth if the composition is hot, and it should be administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method for plaster for joints and bones that have moved from their places, and for accidental pain in them and for splits and fractures: take pure wool and immerse it in sour wine and hot oil and apply it to the location.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	Moreover, in this plaster there is no virtue of restoration, but it is good for treating abscesses and properly expelling pains.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method for a plaster that restores a broken bone: take fresh leaves of the fig tree and leaves of wild poppy; crush them together and make a plaster from them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Method of preparing a quick plaster for administration during the restoration of a bone fracture and when you want resolution of the pus abscess: take rhizomes of elder, of chamomile and flowers of violets, of flour of spelt, of each one part; mix all together and boil with wine, if the member is not inflamed.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is inflamed, now mix that with cold coriander water or with water and use it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method of making a very strong plaster for resolution compared to the first one, when there is a hard abscess during the restoration of the limb: take rhizomes of elder and seeds of linseed, and pomegranate flowers, melilot, marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile, of each one equal part; mix all together and boil with savory water or with gentle water or with wine, whichever suits the condition of the limb and according to its repose by its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	But Hippocrates does not mention in his book that it should be paused on the broken limb during its restoration other than wax made of beeswax and oil, and he recommends that it be moderate between coarseness and fineness.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	But in Wales, it is observed that they are applied to the broken limb during its restoration and for causes where there is a slight drying with warmth as well as substances like myrrh, onions, and similar to those causes which we have recommended.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Method of preparing a plaster to relieve injury and pain: take pitch, linseed, human hair cut or bird's feathers, and elder, and salt, equal parts; mix all together, sift them, and boil, then make into a plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	The quantity according to which it is necessary for the bandage to remain and then be loosened is that you consider whether pain does not occur or improvement does not take place nor is the bone out of its place; therefore, do not loosen it for several days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if intense pain or improvement or inflammation occurs at the site, then you should be cautious or loosen it at that hour, and remove the plaster from there.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take linen cloth and a sponge soaked in seawater, and immerse it in fresh water, then use it to wash the area until the inflammation subsides and the pain is alleviated; afterward let the limb rest for an hour; then place it on wool saturated with vinegar and oil or scented oil, and bind it there overnight until you are sure that no abscess has formed, and until the swelling of the limb has subsided, and the pain from it is relieved.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And afterward, repeat that gentle bandaging and small plaster without tightening it as much as the first time, and gently do this until it is healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if you find that the abscess, swelling, pain, and inflammation have all subsided completely, and you need a plaster and bandaging, then repeat that as you did at the beginning, similarly.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no cause arises for the limb of those we have mentioned, then do not loosen it until after three or four or ten or seven days; and in some cases all of this is left for twenty days, as you deem appropriate by loosening the bandage, as we have said, until the fracture adheres, and the flesh coagulates over it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	At this time adjust the tightening more than in your first stricture entirely, and adjust according to the thickening of the patient's flesh, as was preceded by the recollection of it.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see the site of the fracture already drying and becoming more exposed than is necessary, then you will know that nutrition is prohibited from reaching it; and therefore apply to it a plaster with vinegar which you should always replace whenever it dries out; and do this for all three days; and loosen the bandage slightly, and by this operation direct nutrition to the member, and it is healed quickly.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But what those foolish restorers of the fractured member do otherwise when it is not restored at the beginning as necessary, and is restored according to its tortuosity, is an error according to their operation, and great fear, and if there were a judge, this would be greatly enlarged in the Ancients' books and recognized as such.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of them do this, which is why it is more reasonable that they should not do so.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter second: On fracture when it occurs in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The types of fractures are many, and their figures are diverse, and the causes are distinct, for some fractures are caused by the impact of an object, and the impact removes all the bone within the skull, which is behind the bone, just as it would in wood, and thus this type is named a schiña; or the object incises some part of the bone, and cuts into the flesh but does not penetrate beyond that point; and this species of fracture is called absolute elevation.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	This is about the injury of these two fractures, either it is great or small, and of the fracture that is comminuted or crushed; and the cause of them is impact with poor ground or falling on stone, and things similar to this.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is penetrating, which approaches the peritoneum below the bone; or it is on the surface of the bone, and the injury of these two fractures is either great or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And of the fracture that is weakened in the bone, in the subtlety of the small hair-like structures, and for this reason this particular type of fracture is named capillary.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And it is a fracture that is caused either by falling or by the impact of a stone and similar actions, which causes some fragments of the bone to enter into the soft tissues, and it occurs in the concave location just as it happens with ribs when they are impacted and broken inwardly into the surrounding tissues.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And this is more commonly caused in the bones of children's bodies, just as it happens with the heads of infants.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And for all these types of fractures, treatments are used, which are remedies applied separately.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I will return to the recall of all this in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And you will recognize all these types of fractures by detection on them and by inquiry into their symptoms and the appearance of damaged flesh that is over them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And the capillary fracture is recognized by this: it appears on the bone, and when it is cleaned and examined with a probe, the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	In the treatment of fracture consider at the beginning the symptoms of the patient, and if you see by the symptoms that it signifies clearly from fear, as is vomiting of bile, and extension, and loss of understanding, and hoarseness of voice, and fainting, and acute fever, and such like of the symptoms in the major dispositions, without doubt it is not healed.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you see unusual symptoms that give hope of health, then you begin the treatment of it.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The cause of which is known when it comes to you as a condition in the beginning as it is a condition and this is on the days of winter, then it is necessary that you study the nature of the bone before the fourteenth day according to all dispositions.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is on the days of summer, then it is necessary that you expose the bone before the seventh day, knowing that what is around the bone may become corrupted by pus, and that symptoms which we have recounted may occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the dura mater covering the brain and is in small pieces and abrasions, then it is necessary that you excise the comminuted and abraded part, as I shall relate to you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And it is that you shave the head of the patient who is afflicted, and uncover the bone according to custom and method as best you can according to the shape of the injury, and that it be clear on the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if it happens to you that the detection of the bone, bleeding, or abscess requires caution, then you must proceed with what is necessary, which is to apply the area with cloths infused in wine and rose oil, and let the wound rest until the abscess is subdued, and you are sure there is no further bleeding; then begin the circumvention of the bone and its removal.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	In this way it should be done according to one of two methods of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And one method is that you incise the bone with an incisor of such a shape, and this is its form: And then apply another incisor, this one slightly wider than the previous one; and this is its form:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then apply an even wider incisor than the second one.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And it is necessary to have several different incisors, some of which are wider than others; and some of them are shorter than the others, and their tips should be sharp, made of iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them with ease during percussion on the incisors so that you do not damage the head and tip of them.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is hard and strong, it is necessary to drill around it before you apply the incisors with the chisels, which are called non-profound chisels.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are called this because these do not reach the depth of the bone of the head as far as what is adjacent to it; therefore, the chisel has a rounded tip or margin above which is like a small circle or margin that prevents it from being submerged and passing through the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take many of these chisels, each of which should be suitable for the thickness of each bone, so that you have present in all parts of the head an end that is sharp, with a quantity in length and shortness according to the thickness of this part.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	This is the form of three kinds of probes: The quality of piercing around the broken bone is that you place the probe on the bone and revolve it with your fingers until you know that the bone has been penetrated; then move the probe to another spot, and insert it throughout to a depth equal to the thickness of the shaft or about there.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then incise with an instrument what is between each piece of the bone, and make that pus as fine as you can at the end for lightness, as we have said, until you eradicate the bone, or by your hand, or by some other cause through disturbances which you will have prepared for this purpose, such as probes and fine forceps.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And it is necessary that you guard with all caution that the incisor does not touch any part of the wound.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And so when you have perforated around the bone, and it will be separated from the wound if it is continuous there, and you will extract that, then rasp and smooth that in the roughness of the place where it is in the bone with another tool similar to an incisor, but it must be softer and finer than other incisors.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if any part of the small broken bones remains and you are struggling with it, now take that with ease using what is at hand among your tools; and then treat the wound with lint and dressings as we have mentioned.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other method of operation is light, distant from fear, which Guilla and the lauzec praise greatly; and this is the speech about it: It is necessary for you at the beginning to start uncovering the part of the bone in the place where the fracture is most severe and obvious, until when you have uncovered that part and you have placed below it the extremity of this slow and cheerful incisor, which has this form:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And so the lens-shaped part is solid and does not divide for any cause, and the sharp part divides it into two parts lengthwise, as often happens; that the lens-shaped part fit to the suture with the dividing surface sharp on the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And therefore, you strike upon the sutures of a part with a small hammer so that you divide all the bone easily as it is revolved, and you be sure of the periosteum so that no accident happens in any way, and if the surgeon were the most foolish of all men and the least knowledgeable among them; certainly, and if he were asleep.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	Now if there is any cause attached to the bone of the periosteum in some places of bone, it will divide that which is near the end of the lens-shaped suture, and it will separate easily, for it separates without harm or fear.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate into the periosteum, and that which is separated or remains of the bone is its surface, and it remains in roughness and small protrusions, now you should shave off that roughness and eradicate those protrusions with fine razors for which you have prepared different quantities so that you can administer those most suitable for each location and most appropriate according to how your operation leads on that broken bone and the shape of it.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And you should administer according to your proportion at which you shave the bone initially with the widest of those razors, and then gradually use the finer ones, and do not cease doing this continuously until you reach administering the thinnest and finest of all of them.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	But in each of the other small, hairline fractures and subtle fractures, you should administer care according to what is needed for the correction of them.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is not surprising that they are not amazed by all those who have studied in that art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And this concerns what we have written about the great fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the fat is rectangular when you remove the bone, then cover it with a piece of cloth according to the size of the wound, and immerse that in rose oil, and place it over the opening of the wound; and then take another folded or triple-layered piece of cloth and immerse it in vinegar and rose oil, and place it on the first cloth, doing this as gently as possible so as not to disturb the tissue; and then apply a linen bandage, but do not wrap it tightly except just enough to cover the wound.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And leave it like this for one day or two until you are sure of the condition of the abscess; and then untie it and administer medicines that relieve excessive dryness, such as linseed poultice and flour of oats, and powder of vetches and of aristology, and similar remedies.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And it is that you should make these medicines into a powder that is finely ground and applied to the wound when they are dry; and generally, administer any medicine whose property is to cleanse without irritating.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And act according to your virtue so that the wound in your treatment remains clean; do not let it become infected or worsen; and do not allow its virulence to increase. For when it is properly applied to the fat of the brain, it corrupts it, weakens it, and leads to further illness due to this malevolent condition.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And it affects the tissue of the head, as when the bone is cleansed and especially when the treatment of it is postponed, there appears a blackness on its surface; and therefore consider whether it leads to the illnesses we have mentioned, for then you should be wary without any doubt.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas iii, e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if the blackness does not come from medicine that was applied above it, but rather due to the virtue of that medicine which caused the blackness, then you should take one part honey and three parts olive oil, and with these anoint a cloth, and immediately apply that over the wound; and afterward treat it with the spices appropriate for healing until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	On the restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that the nose is not broken into more than two main parts, or occasionally just one of them, because there are two bones in it; the lower part is cartilaginous and does not break, but only becomes bruised, swollen, and distorted.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two parts of it is broken, then you should insert your little finger into the side of the nose, and adjust that fracture with your finger inside, and hold it in place externally until the nose returns to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And do this with ease, and be careful that your operation does not cause pain to the patient.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the uppermost part of the nose, and your finger cannot reach it, then you should use the tip of a probe with some thickness.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then you should proceed as described above.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And attempt the restoration of it on the first day of the fracture if possible; and if not, then wait until the seventh or tenth day when the swelling has subsided.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	Approach the end of the nose with a piece of linen cloth if the fracture is in one piece, or use two pieces if the fracture is in two parts, and let each piece be thick enough to fill the groove of the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	Some of the ancient restorers say that the cloths should be dipped in butter and changed every day, but I have not seen this done; however, it is advisable to dip the cloth in egg whites mixed with powdered sugar, and then place the cloth on until the bone is set and the cartilage has hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And in some cases, a piece of leather wrapped in linen should be inserted into the nose instead of cloths, if the fracture of the nose is more severe and the patient is not prohibited from breathing through it.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this method is not necessary for you; if you prefer, do this, and if you prefer, use cloths.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another situation arises requiring cauterization, apply a plaster to the nose with pitch or wax dipped in vinegar and rose oil, or with cerate.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	But if cauterization is not necessary, then you should apply a plaster outside with sesame flour and powdered herbs mixed with egg whites; place it over a piece of linen, and do not cover the nose with anything.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	But if the bones of the nose are broken with a small fracture or crushed, then you should cut around them and extract them using instruments suitable for that purpose; then close the gap and treat it with substances that promote healing and consolidation, and use appropriate plasters.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if it happens that plague befalls the nose, now you must treat it with poultices and administer lead tubes inside until it is completely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter IV.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	On the restoration of the jaw when it is dislocated.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the lower jaw is broken and the fracture does not have inflammation, observe now whether the fracture is only outwardly displaced, and it is not broken into two pieces and curved inward, then its diagnosis is easy.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And what you must do, if the fracture is on the right side, is to insert your left thumb into the mouth of the patient; and similarly, if the fracture is on the left jaw, then insert your right thumb; and press with it inside the swelling of the fracture outwardly with ease using your other hand from outside the bone; do this gently.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the jaw fracture is already separated into two parts, then you must administer extension of both parts according to straightness as much as possible until they are aligned.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if it happens that the teeth are knocked out due to a disruption, then strengthen those of which you expect them to break with a thread of gold or silver or silk; and immediately apply a cloth on the broken jaw, and then place it on a doubled cloth, and place on it a bandage properly made, or a piece of softened leather equal in length to the jaw; and then tie it above as is convenient for you to secure the binding and appropriate application, so that it is not destroyed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And he commands the patient to use rest and tranquility, and to pause from eating liquid foods.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you find that the shape has already been altered in any way, then on the third day you should apply heat and loosen it; and afterward, correct what has already been altered with powder of myrtle, egg white, or flour of chickpeas, after you have removed the cerate from it, and place over the dressing a piece of linen.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And then when it is attached and adjusted to the plaster on it, and the position of the bone has not been altered, leave it so that you do not loosen it until it is healed and the fracture is strengthened; for in about three weeks this fracture usually becomes strong.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if an abscess occurs at another time, then administer what we have said should be done during the treatment until it is healed, and allow that abscess to drain.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is with a splinter, then consider whether it is a piece of bone separated or stuck, and you should carefully remove those splinters with what is appropriate for removing them using the instruments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the opening of the splinter is narrow, then you should enlarge it with a scalpel according to the amount necessary for your needs.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And then when you have removed those splinters, and none of them will drain by itself, close the opening of the splinter if it is wide; and if not, place one of the dressings that are appropriate for this on it to promote healing until it is healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 4
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	On the restoration of the collarbone when it is fractured.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	Most often the collarbone is fractured in the part in front of the muscle, and that fracture is made in one of three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	For it is either broken, or separated, or separated into two parts without the occurrence of displacement; and it is easy for its restoration. Or it happens with displacement, and its restoration is difficult; or it happens that the fracture is along the surface.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation in that case, when the fracture is along the surface, is that you should have two assistants present, so that one holds the splint and supports the broken collarbone, and the other extends the arm to that part.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	And then mold the fracture with the fingers so that it is shaped as needed, and there should be neither a small prominence nor a depression.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you need more extension, then place under the armpit of the injured side a pad made of cloth or wool, and its size should be according to your necessity; extend and elevate the collarbone and compress the pad with your hand so that you can mold the fracture as needed.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot pull the end of the collarbone to the outer parts, so that it reaches the clavicle, then have the patient lie on their shoulder, and place under the muscle a pad about half as large.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the assistant presses the muscle below so that the bone of the collarbone is elevated to meet the clavicle, and then you should correct the fracture and mold it with your fingers as needed.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	If you feel pain from the furcula and its maladies, now you must cut into it and extract those pains with ease.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is retained in the bone, now you must devise an incision with one of the instruments that you have prepared for this purpose, since you paused below the furcula the tool that serves as a pick; and this tool is made of wood or iron and has the following form:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is similar to a bowl of which this is the concavity; and its width should be according to what you need from it, depending on the size of the bone or the scarcity of the space.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	But the length of it should be according to what is possible for the operation; let there be two ends as you see fit, and one end should be wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the disruption of the wound that you have incised when extracting the pain from the bone is wide, and you are sure it will form an abscess, now you must bring the two lips of the wound together with a suture.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the disruption is small, or you fear it may form an abscess, now you should treat the wound with plasters and powders according to the quantity of the wound's incision.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if an abscess does occur, now apply a plaster made of green vegetables and rose oil mixed with vinegar, and place it over the area.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	But the immobilization of the bone when it is in a wound and section, is that you place a plaster made of flour mixed with egg white, and put it on the affected area, and then place a sphere under the swelling if needed, and then take bandages, which are like what the Saracens use, about as long as one palm or around that size; and then place double powders over the affected area and plaster; and then take a thin board of approximately three fingers in width and similarly long; and then wrap it in cloth, and then wrap this cloth around the board at the location above the fracture site; and then apply bandages as they are rolled, and roll them from the neck and under the swelling and below the fracture point, and reduce it over all parts, and when you see that the immobilization of the fracture is properly set, and that is not hidden from you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And do not let the splint press down on the broken bone; and therefore it is necessary that you see the patient every day, so that when the bandage has loosened or you see the splint already moved, then you must correct this and tighten the binding.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And place the patient's pillow on their neck, and place beneath it a small roll to elevate the support of their back, so that when the fracture of the collarbone is elevated by the muscles, or the arm is bandaged to the neck.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not loosen the bandage unless an abscess occurs in the vicinity or within xii days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And then renew the plaster if you see that the face of it needs it, and adjust it to the constriction and restore it until it is restored and the collarbone fracture is healed.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it is tightened and comforted according to the measure in xxviii days, and in some cases it is done in less time for some people.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	On the restoration of a shoulder fracture.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The shoulder blade is broken in the middle and not shattered but only cracked at the edges.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And when it is broken in that place — and it is broken in the middle — and it is known only by touch, then according to the figure of the fracture prepare yourself and reduce it according to its natural shape in every way that is possible for you.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And then pause over the place where you sprinkle powdered egg white and stop there; and then pause over the doubled cloth; and then pause over the sieve, taking a small amount of powder according to the quantity of the spoon all or at most a little.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if you leave the sieve with a hollow in some part of the spoon, then you fill that hollow with cloth and then press the sieve according to equality.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And then apply pressure above with a metallic hook of appropriate length and with firmness to the sieve so that it does not move from its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	And examine the bandage each day; and every time it is softened, change it on another day and tighten it and adjust the sieve if it has moved from its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And place the dressing on its side as is appropriate.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	And the spoon is restored in xx days or in .xxv. 
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	When this number is complete, then you dissolve the bandage, and you know for certain which are the bones of which the beginning is not feared nor their dissolution.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you proceed with the piece of bone and place the chain underneath it, then you cut above it, remove it, and do as we have said regarding the fracture of the collarbone or abscess cauterization if this occurs here.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	On the restoration of a foot fracture.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The foot sometimes is broken in the middle and remains there; but the ends move as cicadas do, moving separately and apart.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And of the conditions when the middle of it is broken, it is that it inclines towards the internal parts and there occurs great pain, difficulty in movement, coughing, fever, vomiting blood; and it is evident in the cavity of the broken bone and not hidden from sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And the restoration of it is that the patient be laid supine on their bed, and place a cushion between their shoulders; then gently press the muscles, and adjust the ribs by bringing together more than two ribs, and carefully perform the operation and adjustment in every possible way suitable for this, until the figure of the bone returns as required.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	And then place over it a plaster and cotton, and place beneath it thin splints of wood or reeds or something similar in lightness, after which you wrap that in cloth; then gently bind that over the broken bone without putting too much pressure; and go around the binding several times along the back, and tighten that with appropriate firmness; and then examine the bandage at all times, and when it becomes loose, tighten it.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if necessity compels the removal of that which has been corroded or protruded or caused pain or an abscess in the area, then you should cut and loosen it and remove the plaster and correct what happened with this method of treatment; and immediately replace the plaster if you have to do so for that part; and adjust the tightness until it is healed.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	On the restoration of ribs when they are broken.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	Know that a fracture of the ribs does not occur except in thick parts where they meet; and at their extremities in front, such fractures do not happen because those parts are cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And the knowledge of it is not hidden to the sense of touch during the examination of the aforementioned parts.
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the restoration should be such that it equalizes the fracture of the aforementioned parts according to the possible method, until it is set as needed, and then apply plaster and bind the broken bone with a splint if necessary.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	And if the fracture of the ribs inclines towards the inner parts, then severe pain and piercing occur, just as in the case of one who has wept, and because of this, the bone puts pressure on the membrane; and it leads to difficulty in breathing, coughing, and vomiting blood; and this is difficult to treat.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And the Ancients were skilled in that with powerful remedies.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And what they say is: it is necessary to avoid foods that cause severe inflammation and gas, so that the abdomen becomes inflated and extended, and the fracture is pushed outward.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	Let us proceed with what is necessary to avoid causing unnecessary harm that might lead to the formation of an abscess by cautery, if it does not already exist; and if it has already occurred, now help with this.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And some of them say that it should be placed above the wound and near where it draws up strength; and this is similar to reasoning, but it is feared that the wound may draw the superfluities to the place due to its weakness.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	And some of them say: cover the place with wool that has already been submerged in hot oil, and place poultices between the ribs until it is filled, so that the bandage fits according to its roundness; and treat the wound as you would for the cure of pleurisy with food and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	And if the wound is caused by violent constriction that cannot be tolerated, and the bone pierces through the membrane at a point, we fear for the wound; now it should be necessary to cut above the location, expose the broken rib, and then place an instrument that preserves the safety previously determined, and with ease, incise the bone and extract it.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And then we adjust the two edges of the wound, if it is large, by stitching, and treat it with plasters until it is healed.
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if an abscess occurs internally, now you should incise it and apply poultices in rose oil on the area, and treat the wound with what is appropriate for an internal abscess.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And let them lie supine on the side on which they sleep until they are healed.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On the restoration of fractures of the cervical vertebrae and the collarbone.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	In some cases, fractures occur in the bones of the collar, and treatment for them is similarly applied to the vertebrae of the spine.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And when this happens to someone and you want to know if they will recover or not, at that moment consider: if you see their limbs already softened, numb, and dead, and they cannot move or stretch them, and when you press on those areas with your fingers or pierce them with a needle and there is no feeling of pain, then you understand that they are not going to recover, and in such conditions it is fatal.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if you move those limbs and feel constriction when pressing on them and piercing them with a needle, then you understand that the vertebra is safe and that the patient will recover with treatment.
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if the vertebrae of the neck show similar symptoms and you want to know whether they will recover or not, then observe their breathing.
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	At this point, if you see that they are already weakened and the condition affecting them is similar to what happens in their limbs, and shortly after lying on their back, they experience vomiting and involuntary defecation, and sometimes they lie on their back and want to urinate but cannot, then you understand that it is fatal, and at that moment there is no need to work on treating them.
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	But if none of those symptoms occur, then the cause is better and farther from being fatal.
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	And the treatment for them is to apply a poultice to reduce the abscess on the affected vertebra. Place over it, at times, rose oil or boiled linseed; place this over it several times until the abscess is reduced.
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	During the hours, apply one of the comfortable and stimulating plasters, and place it over that area; and command the patient to use rest and tranquility and not to sleep on the side where there is pain until it is healed.
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	And if it happens that the bone is bruised or for some cause has already become separated from it, then place a cloth over the wound and remove that bone; and immediately adjust the two lips of the wound, using stitches if it is large; and thereafter treat it with one of the ingredients of the remedies until it is healed.
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	But if the tip of the bone is broken and it is the end of the limb, then place your finger of the left hand in the buttock, and align the broken bone with the other hand as much as possible by second-degree reduction; and thereafter apply a plaster and splint to it, if you need those, and secure it.
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	And if you feel bruised and broken bones in it, then act on that, remove them, and treat the wound with the treatment that has been prescribed until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De restauracio de la ancha.	On the restoration of the broad (area).
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the broad areas are often broken, and if they break, then the fracture in them is only communication at the extremities of those bones and they split along their length and incline to the sides; and the patient experiences pain in that location and puncture, and the movement is restricted when it is fractured.
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And the restoration of it is that you extend your hand over it until it aligns with the figure of the fracture.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	And if the fracture is at the extremity of the limb, then you should apply padding according to what seems appropriate to you by way of equalization until it resembles its natural shape.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	And if the fracture is in the long bone that inclines towards the lower parts, then you should have the patient lie on their back so that you may prepare for the restoration of that fracture.
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And when you have padded that, place an emplaster over it, and then place over that a splint of wood or cane, and bind with bandages in such a way that you do not fear any point of the fracture nor movement of the splint.
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	And pad the concavity with what fills that space until it takes the binding according to equality, and instruct the patient to sleep on their back or side.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	And if an abscess occurs suddenly, then you should stop the extension of the limb and its restoration until the abscess is brought under control, and apply what soothes it as has been done previously; and then return to the restoration of the limb, and bind it as is appropriate.
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	And if you encounter crushed or comminuted bones, then you must treat them accordingly.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	On the restoration of the fracture of the adjunct (note: "adjutori" may refer to a specific part or bone, possibly translated as "auxiliary bone" or a supporting structure, depending on the context). For precise translation, more context would be helpful, but based on the text, it refers to the restoration of a fracture involving an auxiliary or supportive bone.
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	The adjunct is what is between the shoulder blade and the top of the shoulder.
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is broken, the restoration of it is in one of two ways, of which the first is that you take smooth wood of medium thickness in this form:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	And let it be held in two places by threads, and let it be suspended from a high place.
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	And let the patient lie on a stool; and then lay the broken arm over the wood until it reaches the midpoint where the curve of the wood is attached.
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	And then suspend something heavy on that, or the patient will extend it to the lower parts; and then the physician should place the fracture with its sides upwards until the fracture returns to its proper position.
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	And the other way is that the patient lies supine on their back and suspend the arm at the neck with a thread; then command two assistants, one to hold above the fracture with its upper part, and the other to hold below it; each should extend it in their direction.
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	And if you want the extension to be stronger, then tie threads above and below the fracture, and each of the two assistants should pull in their respective directions.
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	And if the fracture is near the end of the muscle, then it is necessary to place half of the thread over the midpoint and the other part below the fracture towards the joint.
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	And similarly, if the fracture is near the joint, then it is necessary to place the thread over that location and above the joint.
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	Take that [wound or incision] with ease and work on it, and as soon as it is well healed according to what is needed, then strengthen it if an abscess does not occur.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	But if an abscess does occur, then loosen the stitches internally on the seventh day, and place over it a sponge soaked in vinegar and rose water until the abscess subsides, and then you can strengthen it.
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	And the method of strengthening it is to apply a plaster over the fracture, and then place a bandage of wet cloth over the plaster; and then adjust the arm on that support, and place its hand upon its own muscle.
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And place the cloth and strengthen it over the support for the arm so that the arm is in a position of stability, if there is no cause prohibiting this from the broken bone.
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And now use a splint.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And it is that you place on the fracture a splint that is thicker and stronger than the other splints; and place between each splint the width of a finger, and let the length of the splints be according to the fracture with an addition of three fingers from all sides.
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And then strengthen it on the splints with the bandaging method that I mentioned at the beginning of the chapter.
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And it is that your bandaging over the site of the fracture should be tighter.
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And when the fracture is longer, the bandaging should be lighter.
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	And so, when you see the situation of the splints and the bandaging as we have said during the time when you restore the limb to its proper position, then you should proceed accordingly.
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you fear an abscess, apply caustic on the seventh day as we have said.
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	And for this reason, consider bandaging all parts for three days so that nothing happens in the place of swelling or inflammation; or food should not reach the member due to excess tension; and thus correct everything as we have said.
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	But if you are confident that no cause of this will occur, then do not loosen the bandage for at least three days or more.
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	And let the patient lie on their back, and their head should be raised to rest on their shoulders so that it is above the stomach.
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	And place a padding filled with wool over the helper, and at all times of the night or day ensure that the figure of the broken limb is not loosened or dissolved, nor should the bandage be too slack; thus correct this with your skill.
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.
